Module lanat
Package lanat.parsing.errors.formatGenerators

Class PrettyErrorFormatter

java.lang.Object
lanat.parsing.errors.ErrorFormatter
lanat.parsing.errors.formatGenerators.PrettyErrorFormatter
All Implemented Interfaces:
ErrorLevelProvider
public class PrettyErrorFormatter extends ErrorFormatter
An error formatter that displays the error in the next format: 
  ┌─$ERRORLEVEL
 $INPUT
  │ $CONTENTS
  └─────── ───── ── ─
With, the values being:
  • $ERRORLEVEL: The error level
  • $INPUT: The whole input. Either all the tokens, or the whole input string
  • $CONTENTS: The content of the error
The generated error is colored according to the error level.

    • generateTokensView

      @Nullable protected @Nullable textFormatter.TextFormatter generateTokensView(@NotNull @NotNull ParseErrorContext ctx)
      Description copied from class: ErrorFormatter
      Generates the tokens view for a parse error when the error is a Error.ParseError.

      The tokens view is a view of the tokens that were passed to the parser.

      This method should not be called directly, but rather ErrorFormatter.getGeneratedView().

      Specified by:
      generateTokensView in class ErrorFormatter
      Parameters:
      ctx - the current error context, in this case a parse error context
      Returns:
      the TextFormatter representing the tokens view

    • generateInputView

      @Nullable protected @Nullable textFormatter.TextFormatter generateInputView(@NotNull @NotNull TokenizeErrorContext ctx)
      Description copied from class: ErrorFormatter
      Generates the input view for a tokenize error when the error is a Error.TokenizeError.

      The input view is the raw input string that was passed to the tokenizer.

      This method should not be called directly, but rather ErrorFormatter.getGeneratedView().

      Specified by:
      generateInputView in class ErrorFormatter
      Parameters:
      ctx - the current error context, in this case a tokenize error context
      Returns:
      the TextFormatter representing the input view
